weave.utils

Class CSVParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • weave.utils.CSVParser

  • public class CSVParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses and generates CSV-encoded tables. Also supports custom delimiters and quotes.
    Author:
    adufilie

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static char CR 
      static CSVParser defaultParser 
      static char LF 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CSVParser()
      This is the default constructor which creates a CSVParser having a delimiter of ',' and a quote of '"'.
      CSVParser(char delimiter)
      Use this to specify a custom delimiter.
      CSVParser(char delimiter, char quote)
      Use this to specify custom delimiter and quote symbols.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CSVParser

        public CSVParser()
        This is the default constructor which creates a CSVParser having a delimiter of ',' and a quote of '"'.

      • CSVParser

        public CSVParser(char delimiter)
        Use this to specify a custom delimiter.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The character used to separate values in a single line.

      • CSVParser

        public CSVParser(char delimiter,
         char quote)
        Use this to specify custom delimiter and quote symbols.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The character used to separate values in a single line.
        quote - The character used to surround values so that they may contain the delimiter.

    • Method Detail

      • parseCSVToken

        public java.lang.String parseCSVToken(java.lang.String token)
        This function will decode a CSV token, removing quotes and un-escaping quotes where applicable. If the String begins with a " then the characters up until the matching " will be parsed, replacing "" with ". For example, the String "ab,c""xyz" becomes ab,c"xyz
        Parameters:
        token - The CSV-encoded token to parse.
        Returns:
        The result of parsing the token.

      • createCSVToken

        public java.lang.String createCSVToken(java.lang.String str,
                              boolean quoteEmptyStrings)
        This function encodes a String as a CSV token, adding quotes around it and replacing " with "" if necessary. For example, the String ab,c"xyz becomes "ab,c""xyz"
        Parameters:
        str - The String to encode as a CSV token.
        Returns:
        The String encoded as a CSV token.

      • parseCSVRow

        public java.lang.String[] parseCSVRow(java.lang.String csvData,
                             boolean parseTokens)
        This function parses a String as a CSV-encoded row.
        Parameters:
        csvData - The CSV string to parse.
        parseTokens - If this is true, tokens surrounded in quotes will be unquoted and escaped characters will be unescaped.
        Returns:
        The result of parsing the CSV string.

      • parseCSV

        public java.lang.String[][] parseCSV(java.lang.String csvData,
                            boolean parseTokens)
        This function parses a String as a CSV-encoded table.
        Parameters:
        csvData - The CSV string to parse.
        parseTokens - If this is true, tokens surrounded in quotes will be unquoted and escaped characters will be unescaped.
        Returns:
        The result of parsing the CSV string.

      • parseCSV

        public java.lang.String[][] parseCSV(java.io.File csvFile,
                            boolean parseTokens)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This function parses a String as a CSV-encoded table.
        Parameters:
        csvFile - The CSV file to parse.
        parseTokens - If this is true, tokens surrounded in quotes will be unquoted and escaped characters will be unescaped.
        Returns:
        The result of parsing the CSV string.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • parseCSV

        public java.lang.String[][] parseCSV(java.io.InputStream csvInput,
                            boolean parseTokens)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This function parses a String as a CSV-encoded table.
        Parameters:
        csvInput - The CSV input to parse.
        parseTokens - If this is true, tokens surrounded in quotes will be unquoted and escaped characters will be unescaped.
        Returns:
        The result of parsing the CSV string.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createCSVRow

        public java.lang.String createCSVRow(java.lang.Object[] row,
                            boolean quoteEmptyStrings)
        This function encodes an Array of objects into a CSV row.
        Parameters:
        row - An array of values for a single row. If the row values are not Strings, toString() will be called on each value.
        Returns:
        The row encoded as a CSV String.

      • createCSV

        public java.lang.String createCSV(java.lang.Object[][] rows,
                         boolean quoteEmptyStrings,
                         boolean endingLineFeed)
        This function converts a table of Strings (or Objects) and encodes them as a single CSV String.
        Parameters:
        rows - An array of rows. If the row values are not Strings, toString() will be called on each value.
        Returns:
        The rows encoded as a CSV String.

      • createCSV

        public void createCSV(java.lang.Object[][] rows,
             boolean quoteEmptyStrings,
             java.lang.Appendable output,
             boolean endingLineFeed)
               throws java.io.IOException
        This function converts a table of Strings (or Objects) and encodes them as a single CSV String.
        Parameters:
        rows - An array of rows. If the row values are not Strings, toString() will be called on each value.
        output - Where the result will be directed.
        endingLineFeed - Set to true to end the output with a line feed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • convertRowsToRecords

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>[] convertRowsToRecords(java.lang.String[][] rows)
        This function converts an Array of Arrays to an Array of Objects compatible with DataGrid.
        Parameters:
        rows - An Array of Arrays, the first being a header line containing property names
        Returns:
        An Array of Objects containing String properties using the names in the header line.

      • getRecordFieldNames

        public java.lang.String[] getRecordFieldNames(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>[] records)
        This function returns a comprehensive list of all the field names defined by a list of record objects.
        Parameters:
        records - An Array of record objects.
        Returns:
        A comprehensive list of all the field names defined by the given record objects.

      • getRecordFieldNames

        public java.lang.String[] getRecordFieldNames(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>[] records,
                                     boolean includeNullFields)
        This function returns a comprehensive list of all the field names defined by a list of record objects.
        Parameters:
        records - An Array of record objects.
        includeNullFields - If this is true, fields that have null values will be included.
        Returns:
        A comprehensive list of all the field names defined by the given record objects.

      • convertRecordsToRows

        public java.lang.String[][] convertRecordsToRows(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>[] records)
        This function converts an Array of Map objects to an Array of Arrays compatible with other functions in this class.
        Parameters:
        records - An Array of Objects containing String properties.
        Returns:
        An Array of Arrays, the first being a header line containing all the property names.

      • convertRecordsToRows

        public java.lang.String[][] convertRecordsToRows(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>[] records,
                                        java.lang.String[] columnOrder)
        This function converts an Array of Map objects to an Array of Arrays compatible with other functions in this class.
        Parameters:
        records - An Array of Objects containing String properties.
        columnOrder - An optional list of column names to use in order.
        Returns:
        An Array of Arrays, the first being a header line containing all the property names.

      • convertRecordsToRows

        public java.lang.String[][] convertRecordsToRows(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>[] records,
                                        java.lang.String[] columnOrder,
                                        boolean allowBlankColumns)
        This function converts an Array of Map objects to an Array of Arrays compatible with other functions in this class.
        Parameters:
        records - An Array of Objects containing String properties.
        columnOrder - An optional list of column names to use in order.
        allowBlankColumns - If this is set to true, then the function will include all columns even if they are blank.
        Returns:
        An Array of Arrays, the first being a header line containing all the property names.
